meaning_str.bing:
v. 借给；给予；借出；（向…）贷（款）
n. (短期)贷款
网络. 把…借给；出借；把某物借给某人

把…借给；出借；把某物借给某人

借给；借出；贷出；贷（款）；给…增加；增添（特色）；给予；提供（帮助、支持等）；使适合；使易遭受

1.en: The Chinese government can just make a call to banks and dictate how much they will lend and at what interest rate.
1.cn: 中国的政府只需要打个电话给银行，告知他们要借多少钱出去，借贷利率是多少就行了。

2.en: "We do not use ratings to invest. We do our own research on anyone we lend money to, and that includes sovereigns, " she said.
2.cn: “我们不是用评等来投资--我们自己会对所有投资对象作研究，这也包括主权体，”她称。

3.en: FOR years I have been trying to lend him of my plenty, but he has always steadfastly refused to put the bite on me.
3.cn: 多年来，我一直想把我花不完的钱借给他，可是他坚决不肯向我借。

0.en: That is exactly why I do not lend you stuff.
0.cn: 所以我才不借给你东西！

1.en: Monica, if you want, I can lend you some money.
1.cn: 莫妮卡，你要的话我可以借你钱。

2.en: I see I'm not needed to lend you strength. You're fully in command of the argument.
2.cn: 看来我不需要助你一臂之力，你完全能控制得住局势。

3.en: Before we lift a fork we lend a hand by going out in the community to serve some of our neighbors in need.
3.cn: 在我们就餐前，我们会到社区中做义工为一些需要的邻居们服务。

4.en: There you go, that's the spirit. Okay. Now, if you need money, I will lend you money, but just get moving.
4.cn: 这就对了！这才是精神所在，你需要钱我借你，你就接吧。

5.en: I never lend out my gear. But you still have your gun. Use it. Just do me a favor. Don't shoot out the window.
5.cn: 我的枪从不外租，但你不是有自己的枪么，用那个，帮我个忙，别打碎玻璃。

6.en: What do you need? My belt. I lend it to the boy who had the accident. My pants don't hold up so good without it.
6.cn: 你要什么？我的皮带。我把它借给出车祸的男生，没它我的裤子系不好。

7.en: He feels as I do and he would say it now, had he voice. Lend him your voice. Speak for Father now and command as Khan.
7.cn: 他的想法和我一样，如果他现在还能说话，一定会和我说同样的话，替他说出他想说的话，为您的父皇发声，像大汗一样号令天下。

8.en: My car just got towed, and my wallet and cellphone were in there. Could you possibly lend me some money for cab fare or...
8.cn: 我的车刚被拖走了，我的钱包和手机都在里面，你能借我点钱打的吗？

9.en: He refuses to pay fines when he's overdue with books I lend him. He crashed the Mars Rover while attempting to impress a woman.
9.cn: 我借给他的书他延期不还，还拒绝缴纳罚款，他为了泡妞而撞毁了火星探测器。

10.en: In the situation with the obnoxious-football-fan-turned-good-samaritan, your brain says, "Well, in my experience, pretty much anyone would lend someone their umbrella, but the way this guy acted at the football game, that was unusual."
10.cn: 在那个情况讨厌的足球迷最后成了好心人，你的大脑说：「嗯，根据我的经验很多人都可以借别人雨伞，但是这个人在足球场的举止却只有他会这样。」
